page.title: 09ASHBY PARVA CHURCH
page.content:
This small church dates back to Norman Times. The tower has 3 bells inscribed in 1591. Memorials in the church remember past Rectors' families, and one local prominent family - the Goodacre family. The Visitors' Book dates from 1939, and shows many widely travelled visitors, the furthest coming from New Zealand. The earliest recorded Rector, Thomas, was Rector in 1220. The oldest grave in the graveyard is for Ann Reynolds who died in 1765. {
{By Karen Drinkwater, Richard Bettle, {Craig Samson, Paul Bettle and Marie {Bradbury. {Class 2. Dunton Bassett Primary {School. }
